solution_line_template: The number of blocks in the second stack is {first_stack_height} + {taller_than_first} = <<{first_stack_height}+{taller_than_first}={second_stack_height}>>{second_stack_height}.
The number of blocks in the third stack is {second_stack_height} - {shorter_than_second} = {third_stack_height}.
The number of blocks in the last stack is {third_stack_height} + {taller_than_third} = <<{third_stack_height}+{taller_than_third}={last_stack_height}>>{last_stack_height}.

Pablo used {first_stack_height} + {second_stack_height} + {third_stack_height} + {last_stack_height} = <<{first_stack_height}+{second_stack_height}+{third_stack_height}+{last_stack_height}={total_blocks}>>{total_blocks} toy blocks in all.
